dialogue.text: Have you ever wondered what happens when a function approaches infinity? Like what does it actually mean mathematically?
Wait, so infinity isn't just a really big number? I always thought it was like the biggest possible number ever!
Exactly! That's the beauty of limits. Infinity is a concept, not a number. When we say the limit approaches infinity, we mean it grows without bound.
Mind blown! So like, if I keep adding one to a number forever, I'm approaching infinity but never actually reaching it?
Precisely! And here's the crazy part - there are actually different sizes of infinity. Some infinities are literally bigger than others!
No way! How can one infinity be bigger than another? That sounds impossible but also incredibly fascinating!
